title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5317.27 - Priority events
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5317.27 - Priority events

State Regulations

The following significant events shall be conveyed to the
MCS in a timely manner in cases where the game is unable to distinguish the
specifics of the event: (a) loss of
communication with interface element; (b) loss of communication with gaming
device; (c) memory corruption of
the Interface element, if storing critical information; and
(d) RAM corruption of the gaming device. It is permissible for each of the significant events
described in paragraphs (a) through (d) of this section to be sent to the
system as a generic error code. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
5317.27

Adopted

New

York State Register November 16, 2016/Volume XXXVIII, Issue 46, eff. 11/16/2016

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
